headline: Simple Shepherd's Pie
description: Here is a shepherd's pie, made easy, that your family will love.
name: Simple Shepherd's Pie
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.75 ounce) can Campbell's® Condensed Cream of Mushroom Soup (Regular or 98% Fat Free)
1.3333333730698 cups instant mashed potato flakes or buds

recipeInstructions.text: Cook beef and onion in 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat until well browned, stirring to break up meat. Pour off fat.
Stir soup, ketchup, black pepper and peas and carrots into skillet. Spoon beef mixture in 9-inch pie plate.
Heat milk and butter in 2-quart saucepan over medium-high heat to a boil. Remove from heat. Slowly stir in potatoes. Spoon potatoes over beef mixture.
Bake at 400 degrees F for 15 minutes or until potatoes are lightly browned.

review.reviewBody: This is not very good. It lacks any taste, seasoning(s), the mushroom soup is lost in the blandness of the pork. I added fresh thyme, kosher salt, garlic, worchestshire sauce and mixed the pork 50/50 med ground beef. Much better. Or even better than that, ditch the mushroom soup and use lamb and make a proper shepherds pie. Just saying.
simple yes, good not so much. It's pretty bland and tasteless
Fast and easy delicious dish . The whole family loves this. Another go to meal

I added 2 tbsp worchestshire sauce to hamburger and added 1bsp onion and garlic powder and omitted the onion. Still cooking but I tasted a bite before putting in the oven and tastes great - I used 2 pkges of instant roasted garlic potatoes rather than the recipe potatoes. Smells wonderful!
I added some grated sharp cheddar cheese between the meat and potatoes. Delicious

I used ground deer instead of beef. I also used the frozen veggies I had on hand, which included corn with green beans and carrots. I used dry milk powder to make a cup of milk. I was already making biscuits, so I used the leftover dough and laid it out across the top of the pie. Turned out great.

Quick and easy (I had leftover mashed potatoes so that saved a bunch of time). I substituted corn for the carrots and did not boil the milk. I just poured the milk over the top of the meat layer. I also topped with a bit of mozzarella. It was delicious and even the kids enjoyed it.
We love it. Great for a quick meal.
That is sooooo good.

I have made this several times. I admit I cheat and use Bob Evans ready-made potatoes for the top instead of making my own. It is faster to make that way and very delicious. I never have leftovers on this dish. Extras gets divided up for lunch the next day! That makes it a winner in my book!

This is really good on those cold nights~ I did a couple of changes though: I used a frozen veggie medley (instead of just peas and carrots) and for the mash, I used the Hormel heat and serve garlic mashed potatoes.

This is a go to when it is a hectic day. Son doesn’t like carrots and peas so I just switch those to corn. We need a vegetable. And I add cheddar cheese a little inside to get it formed better and then overtop the potatoes. Everyone loves it with cheese. But other than that I kept the same. Thank you for recipe.

This turned out pretty well on the second time being made. A few changes I made was to add fresh corn, double the potatoes for the top, and I added more pepper. For some reason, the potato amount didn’t cover the top but that was an easy fix.

Easy,,satisfying dinner. The only issue was the directions for the potatoes are way, way off. I used potato buds and I needed double the butter and a full cup of water, in addition to 1 1/4c milk and a teaspoon salt- perfect! I sprinkled the top with sweet paprika to make it pretty.
Son and I love this. Super easy!
Fantastic! Perfect flavor no need to add additional salt like some other recipes
Instead of ketchup I just added a bit of water. Added a tiny bit of fresh garlic to the mashed potatoes. Very easy and tasty.
Liked it as is. Better with some bell peppers. It’s going on my favorite list.
It was easy to create and tastes great!
Easy, tasty recipe. I made my own mashed potatoes instead of potato flakes. Will make again!

Great recipe and easy to put together. The only substitution I made was using canned mixed vegetables instead of frozen. I also added a sprinkle of shredded cheddar cheese over the top before baking it. Everyone loved it and there were no leftovers! The only thing I would do differently is double the mashed potatoes because I had a hard time trying to spread the potatoes enough to cover everything.

This was pretty good! Definitely will be making again. Next time though I will be adding more seasoning as it was a bit bland for my taste as is and I will also be added more potatoes on top next time. This is going to be added into my meal plan rotation.

Came out great! I made the recipe vegan, using beyond beef, vegan butter and oat milk for the mashed potatoes, and I made my own mushroom soup (just steam cauliflower, mushrooms and onion with some oat milk, once soft blend and season to taste with salt pepper and garlic). Otherwise followed the recipe, very delicious and will definitely make again!
The family loved it! My modifications were using corn instead of the peas and carrots, adding a bit of Worcestershire sauce, garlic, and using cheesy potatoes.
Used pre-made Costco mashed potatoes and added paprika + dried parsley on top. Very good! Whole family enjoyed it.

I'm a chronically under-skilled cook who found this to be easy to make and tasty. The potato mix was good but a hat tip to the review that recommended doing this the day after mashed potatoes and making extra then. Thanks!
I added 1 tsp season Salt and two cans of cream of mushroom soap to make it saucier. It's awesome!!!!

I’m a make everything from scratch kind of girl and don’t do many casseroles. I remembered having this at a church luncheon many years ago. Found this recipe and gave it a shot. I’m feeding three, always hungry teen boys and they aren’t big on casseroles but they really loved this! I used real potatoes and added garlic to meat and onion. I’ve also made this with left over beef roast and it’s fantastic too!
I make this often. It is absolutely delicious and flavorful.
Came out great!!
I added lots of shredded cheese on top before baking!
Not too difficult and pretty darn good thank you!
Great!!! I did use elk instead of hamburger, and added can of creamed corn and Worcestershire, dash cayenne, added in can cream of celery, garlic. It was very delish!

I made this using organic mushroom soup and ketchup, grass fed beef and butter, and Bob's Red Mill instant potatoes. The only substitute was coconut milk, since we are dairy free.
It was quick and easy and very tasty. I plan to make it again.

The recipe was simple! I added fresh garlic with the onion and double the recipe. I also used mixed vegetables and homemade mash potatoes because it was what I had on hand. To top it off covered the top with shredded sharp cheddar cheese because my family is cheese crazy! Super delicious!!! Will make this many times over!!! Great comfort food!
Followed suggestions used Hash Browns for top and added garlic. Turned out great.
I used real mashed potatoes and left out the carrots. Will definitely make again!
I used brown gravy instead of cream of mushrooms.
I made it and everyone ate it. I put cheese on top of the potatoes and it was really good

Next time I would make more potatoes to cover entire top of the dish and bake it in my cast iron skillet. The other reviewer’s tips to spice it up were nice. I added Worcestershire sauce and Dijon to the standard list.
Fairly bland but good with HP sauce.
I love this recipe but I replace instant mashed potatoes with fresh garlic mashed potatoes, an excellent upgrade to this recipe.
Turned out great! Used 3lbs hamburger, 6 potatoes mashed, 2 cans Campbell’s mushroom soup, 2 cans peas, 20 minutes at 350, then 10 more minutes after topping with cheese.
I made this quick and easy recipe. I mixed beef with ground turkey and ground sausage. I prepared the meat as prescribed. I used freshly grated Parmesan cheese on top of the potatoes.
Used broccoli soup I place of mushroom soup and mixed veggies instead of carrots and peas
Using real potatoes versus instant is a must, cream of mushroom added a great gravy.

The base of this was ok. Not very much flavor, so I added maybe 1/2 cup of red wine, and some beef bullion to taste. I also added some garlic salt and Italian seasoning. This made the base much more flavorful. For the mashed potatoes I added some cream cheese and a little milk to combine, then topped it with shredded cheese and french’s fried onions like you would use for green bean casserole. It was so good!
I liked it. It’s simple, easy and tasty! I didn’t put any peas or carrots and broiled mozzarella cheese on top of it. Yummy!
Great recipe! I will definitely make it again. When I do make it again, I am going to add more potatoes than the recipe suggests.
Very easy, simple recipe to guide one. Definitely better when adding herbs and spices that you like to boost the flavor.
Very easy, simple recipe to guide one. Definitely better when adding herbs and spices that you like to boost the flavor.

Was really delicious and easy to make. Used real mashed potatoes and frozen corn instead of the boxed ones. I thought I would have a piece today but my family who are very picky eaters maxed the leftovers later that night. ??

This was really good! For veggies I just used a cup of frozen mixed veggies with corn and green beans as well as carrots and peas and I think it adds to it. I didn’t use all of the milk mixture because it just seemed like too much. Next time I’ll add some salt and pepper to the mashed potatoes. Adding in Frank’s hot sauce made it even better!
Made this for the wife and kids for the first time and they loved! Good old comfort food during this corona virus! I used real potatoes and added corn
Super easy and quick! Great comfort food dish. Skipped the ketchup, and topped with shredded cheese at the end and put it back in to melt and brown the cheese just a touch.
Super easy and quick! Great comfort food dish. Skipped the ketchup, and topped with shredded cheese at the end and put it back in to melt and brown the cheese just a touch.
Came out fantastic
It was really easy to make. I didn't have any carrots so I use peas and corn instead. I will definitely be making this again.
Added some Worcestershire sauce with my venison ground beef.
Omg so delicious although I only used half an onion

Family enjoyed this, I like the ease of this recipe. As others did, I also added onions and garlic to the ground beef. After draining fat added some Lea and Perón, mustard, salt and pepper. This added a little zip. Also used left over warned mashed potatoes and sprinkled some kraft Parmesan cheese on top. Quick and simple
The only substitution I made was using cream of celery soup instead of cream of mushroom. I also doubled the recipe to make 8 servings instead of 4. My wife daughter and I all loved it.
I made this with real mashed potatoes and was very happy with the results! It made more than enough and we froze some for down the road.
Very tasty. We really enjoyed it. I used small sweet frozen corn instead of peas/carrots. I think the next time I make it I will double the recipe for the mashed potatoes.

Love this recipe. Made this for a gathering of friends. I doubled the recipe and used a 9 x 13 pan. Didn't have beef gravy so used a packet of beef onion soup mix instead. I added thickening to make the gravy. Got rave reviews from everyone. A definite keeper.
I used mixed veggies and 1/2 cup of milk. Topped with some cheddar. Hubby loved it
Added cheese to the beef, because kids love cheese, and I've made this with just about any frozen veggies I have on hand and it turns out great! Corn and green beans are good too!
I made this using leftover meatloaf (coarse chopped) and mashed potatoes. All I added were the veggies and condensed soup. Came out very good.

I loved it. I used a package of Idahoan potatoes & they worked fine. Did need to use more than the one cup of milk the recipe called for - closer to 2 cups in order to spread the potatoes over th meat.
Turned out great used real mashed potatoes no left overs
Quick, easy and a big hit with the family. I added 1tbsp Worcestershire Sauce to kick it up a notch and use mixed vegetables in place of peas & carrots.

My hubby and I went crazy over this!! I made a few slight adjustments. When browning the ground beef, I also used shallots, chopped celery and chopped parsnips to add some flavor. In addition to the peas and carrots, I also added some Lima beans to the mix and instead of ketchup I used 2 tablespoons of sofrito and just a splash of beef broth. I also used ready- made mashed potatoes to save a few minutes of prep time. Amazing flavor!
It was awesome! Best one I have ever had!

We only added shredded cheese, otherwise we stuck to the directions. The instant potatoes were Buttery Homestyle Idahoan Mashed potatoes. So easy and quick, everyone was satisfied and we’ll make this again.

easy throw together meal. Easy to customize too. For example I add greek seasoning to my meat and use whatever frozen veggies I have on hand. Sometimes instant potatoes sometimes homemade. I also never measure with this recipe and it always turns out
I did a whole different twist

This was so easy and tasty! I used a GF cream of mushroom soup (Pacific Foods) and added some diced mushrooms on top. I look forward to making it again, experimenting with stewed tomatoes and other seasonings.
Decent as directed. Would do again.
Awesome if your on the run like me this is how I did it!
will make it again
Quick, yet filling and warms the belly!! My family wiped it out, next time I have to triple the recipe. :)
I’ll make this again. It was really good!

I tried this recipe based on the ratings and I know I’m not in the majority, but I thought it was bland. While there was nothing wrong with it, my family and I didn’t like it. I think we’re used to a heartier recipe.

I use just corn for veggies and add some hot sauce in the meat mixture. Then, some mozzarella cheese and garlic pepper in the mashed potatoes, 
Delicious! Huge hit in my family, make this all the time.
good recipe. added an extra cup of veggies and some worcestshire. used leftover makes potatoes. hubby liked it. will make again!
This has quickly become a family favorite.

It was delicious! I do use use corn for my veggie (just a personal preference ) and I sprinkle on shredded cheese for the last five minutes that I bake it. My husband and I both love it. It’s a recipe that I definitely have in my rotation. It’s oh so yummy!

I made this exactly like recipe, the only change I made was to make 4 individual pies instead of one big one. My husband and I had one each when I made them and the other two we reheated later in the week. I just added a tab of butter on top of the potatoes before reheating. This recipe is definitely a keeper! Delicious!

This recipe was alright, although it wasn't my favorite. It's possible I messed up the potatoes because they were a major problem simply because they didn't spread very well over the top of the meat mixture. I also definitely think the meat and veggies mixture could have used a few more spices or something to give it a little bit more flavor.
Made vegetarian using Quorn meatless grounds and it was delicious!
Simple, easy and quick. Great for family with children next time I'll spice it up a bit for finicky adults
absolutely amazing!!! I thought that using instant potatoes would change the quality but using milk instead of water made it perfect and just as quick. my new favorite recipe.

I added some shredded cheese to the top, used a casserole dish and a large onion, and while bag of frozen vegetables with a double of the mashed potatoes on top. Enough for 3 people to eat off of for a week
Easy to make, just waiting on the results, but am certain it will be very good! We used ground lamb for our Easter meal,
I changed it up a bit, didnt use soup made mine with venison and more xed veg along with sautéed mushroom and beef bullion cubes fir flavor along with onions delicious!!!
Subsituted with turkey meat but otherwise followed the recipe. Family ate the whole thing! Love it.

The only reason this didn't get 5 stars is because I varied it so as not to use canned soup. I used a cast iron skillet: brown 3 T butter with 1/2 chopped yellow onion. Add 4 T. basil pesto. Brown @ 1 min. Add 1/3 c. flour and brown for @5 min. Add 1 c milk, & stir continuously until it is incorporated. Repeat with 2 more cups of milk, one cup at a time. THEN add the veggies and meat (I used chicken in this case), cook a bit, and top with the mashed potatoes. Transfer the skillet of yumminess to the preheated 400 degree oven and bake 20 minutes. Delicious!

I made this recipe and really liked it. It was very quick and easy, a fast meal for busy families. After the first time I made this I started playing with the recipe. I found a version I love that takes even less time. I used 8 oz instant garlic mashed potatoes instead of 2 cups potatoes. Instead of package directions I made them with 2 cups of milk. I substituted peas and carrots with a bag of frozen green beans mixed in after everything else was mixed. After putting it in 2 qt casserole dish I sprinkled a cup of cheddar cheese on top and then spread the garlic mashed potatoes on top of that.
Our family loves it
